title: User Authentication and Security Framework
summary: Implement secure multi-factor authentication and role-based access control.
description: This epic involves developing a robust authentication and security framework for the self-service banking portal. It includes implementing multi-factor authentication (MFA) to safeguard customer access, enforcing strong password policies, and establishing role-based access controls to restrict user privileges based on authorization levels. The system should securely manage user sessions and ensure protection against common threats such as phishing, brute force attacks, and session hijacking, in compliance with banking security regulations.

title: User Profile and Personalization Module
summary: Create a personalized user dashboard based on customer profile and eligibility.
description: This epic focuses on building a dynamic profile and personalization module that tailors the dashboard content for each user. Based on existing customer data and eligibility, the system should display relevant banking products, services, and recommendations. The module must integrate with the core banking system to fetch customer details in real time and support preference management so users can customize their experience.

title: Responsive User Interface Design
summary: Develop a responsive and intuitive UI for multiple devices.
description: This epic covers the design and development of a responsive, user-friendly interface optimized for desktops, tablets, and mobile phones. The goal is to ensure consistent user experience and accessibility across devices. The interface should follow modern UI/UX principles with an intuitive layout, clear navigation, and accessibility compliance, providing seamless interactions throughout the portal.

title: Account Opening and Service Modification Workflows
summary: Implement streamlined workflows for account requests and modifications.
description: This epic entails designing and implementing end-to-end workflows for users to submit new account opening requests and request modifications to existing services. The workflows should be intuitive and require minimal user input, reducing friction during submissions. Users must be able to save incomplete applications and resume later, as well as upload required documents directly through the portal. The workflows should also support validation checks and user guidance at each step.

title: Real-Time Notifications and Status Tracking
summary: Enable live updates and email notifications for user requests.
description: This epic aims to implement a robust notification and tracking system that provides users with real-time updates on their submitted requests. Users should be able to see the current status within the portal dashboard and receive automated email notifications for key status changes. The system should also support user-configurable notification preferences and be integrated with the workflow engine for seamless event-driven updates.

title: Interaction History and Audit Logging
summary: Maintain comprehensive records of all user interactions and system actions.
description: This epic involves building a detailed audit logging and interaction history mechanism that records all user activities such as request submissions, document uploads, and updates made on the portal. The data should be securely stored and easily retrievable for customer viewing as well as compliance and operational audits. The implementation should ensure data integrity, immutability, and adherence to regulatory retention requirements.

title: Core Banking System Integration
summary: Seamlessly connect the portal with the bank's existing backend systems.
description: This epic focuses on establishing bi-directional integration between the self-service portal and the bankâ€™s core banking systems. The integration must enable real-time synchronization of customer data, account statuses, and service requests while maintaining system performance. It will leverage secure APIs and middleware for communication, ensuring reliability and data consistency between both environments.

title: Portal Database Management and Performance Optimization
summary: Implement a dedicated database layer optimized for portal operations.
description: This epic outlines the design and implementation of a high-performance, secure database to manage portal-specific data. The database must complement the core banking integration by offloading non-core operations while ensuring rapid query response times and reliability. Data encryption at rest and in transit must be enforced, along with appropriate indexing, caching, and load balancing strategies for scalability.
